string.text: I need a strong gravitational artifact..
Alright. Give me the device and the money.
And it's done! Here is the artifact.
What kind of artifacts do you have here?

Yes, I have a special device... It's for artifact transmutation: if you take this device and put the required artifacts inside it it will turn them into a new artifact, but it currently has only a recipe for a strong gravitational artifact. I can provide the ingredients for the conversion; you only need the device itself and 5000 rubles.
After I get the artifacts?
That's right.
Mmh, I need something..
Yeah? What do you need?
The gravity-powered zip gun. I think only you can make it...
Yeah, okay. I need a specific artifact - one of those stronger gravity-based artifacts. Bring it here, and we'll talk.
I've got the artifact.
For the zip gun? Alright, let me put this together.. there you go.
Take your weapon and go.
Mmh, I need something. I need a gravity-based artfiact.
We have it, and we can give it to you, but you need to give me a reason for me to give it to you.
What do you want?
The artifact I need - one of those stronger gravity-based artifacts. Bring it here, and we'll talk. It'll be a fair trade.
I have a question about the artifact you need.
Got it? Okay, there you go...
Get the artifact, please.
Thank you, stalker.
Oh, shit... what happened to him?
Hello.
Hi. Did you manage to find out anything about the missing group?
As you expected, the group was taken prisoner by Sin. I managed to save them.

Let me check something.. I'm detecting their signal on my PDA. I think they're already here. Thank you, stalker. You did great! As gratitude, I'll give you a car for free. It'll be near the bunker. Thank you again.
I found what you asked for.
Really? Well, they're lucky you came by, haha.
Can you release them?
Yes. We'll let them go soon. We need to do something with them before we let them go.
Who do you have in the next room?

Why do you care? We've got a group of scientists in there. They were in the wrong place at the wrong time, heh-heh. They came just in time for our ritual. The heads of those scientists will come in handy.
Wait, you want their heads? No, no, that's not good. I need them alive. I'll buy them from you.
'Buy'? We don't need money. If you really need them alive, bring us three heads and they'll be set free.
Are there any well-paid jobs?

Mmh, yes. About a month ago, we sent four teams to different corners of the Zone for research. The first group died in the Cordon, somewhere around the tower. You discovered the remains of the second group at Shining Path. Another was killed here at the pillbox near the lake. We don't know much about the fourth one.
Go on.

All I know is they disappeared at Silent Hills. Do you know what kind of people live there? Sinners. They're real psychos. I do accept the possibility that they're at their base, and the possibility that they're still alive. If you make it to there, try to help our group. They're the only employees we have left. If you help us, we'll give you a special reward.
Hello. Barkeep sent me. He has business.
Barkeep sent you on business? We've got some "business" too. Listen up - if you're gonna do business with us, get me one of those stronger gravitational artifacts.
I'll try. Where can you find those artifacts?
Near gravity anomalies. It's not your first day in the Zone, is it? After you sort things out, go look for one.
Take this artifact.
Well done, stalker. I think we can work with you.
Can we get to my business?
Yes, certainly.
Do you have any other work?

Have you ever heard of the 'Sinners'? They're truly terrifying - you'll know what I mean when you first run into them. It's rumored that they're holed up in the Silent Hills somewhere. People say that their leader isn't even human, and he's supposedly one of the first in stalkers who made it to the Zone. In short, this is one of the oldest groups in the Zone: they've been here since it appeared. Now, I know that at their base in the Hills, there is a vault with various secret documents inside it. I need you to go there and get me a specific document from that vault. Do you think you can do this for me?
I'll try, but I can't promise anything.
Thank you. Be careful with those Sinners.
Here, take the file.
You were able to get the document from the vault at the Sinner's base? Good job, stalker. This will really help us in learning more about the Zone.
What about the payment?
Yes, certainly. Give me a minute... Here's your money.
Look, I’ve got something. Would this fake eye be of interest to you?
Hmm, a rare thing in the Zone. I'll buy it for 500 rubles.
Here, take it
Interesting stuff. Thank you.
I have some bad news for you.
What? What do you mean?
I found your brother. He's dead. He's in the underground lab at Dark Valley.
Stalker... Could you leave me alone, please? Thank you...
Alright, I'll leave you alone.
I found your cat.
Y-o-o-u, st-t-t-alker. Thank yo-y-you.
No problem, buddy.
T-t-t-th-eee sci-sci-scientists w-were he-he-here earli-li-er. I saw th-them at th-the co-co-cottage..
Are you a zombie? Are you human? Can you hear me?
Yo-yo-you, s-s-st-al-stalker. He-he-he-help, pl-pl-please.
What do you want?
I ha-ha-had a c-c-cat, a b-bi-bi-big on-one. S-she was mu-my best fr-friend. Sh-she al-al-alwa-always hel-he-helped me. I lo-lost h-he-her. Fi-fin-find he-her, pl-pl-plea-please.
You're from the Professor?
Yes. I'm interested in something...

You're interested in something? So am I. Those egghead bastards placed a radiation field from their damn psy-rig right in front of our base. Some of our comrades say that the radiation field is expanding, and it seems it'll reach our base soon. Those eggheads have some weird shit going on... We've traced the source to a house that's left to one of the roads at Silent Hills. I don't want to send any of my men there. The radiation there is so intense that all the grass has faded and evaporated. Go there and see if you can turn that shit off. We'll talk afterwards.
Damn... okay, I'll do it.
Hello. Are you the Doctor?
Yes. I knew you were coming..
I have a few questions.

Hold on a moment, I need your help first, then I'll help you with your questions. Listen carefully: a stalker wandered into the swamp and he's already spent half a day at the fishing lodge. I'm worried about him. Bring him here, but don't let him inside. Let him sit on the porch. Grab the first-aid kit from the stove, you might need it. Also, you'll need to take something from him as payment for my services.
Hey, how are you?
Who's there? A stalker? I need help. I.. came from the Radar. The radiation there.. is intense...
There's a doctor nearby. I think he can help you.
A doctor?! Let's go...
Doctor, I left him on your porch. He's halfway gone. He says he came from the Radar.
Let him rest there for a while. Go to him and find out where he's from, what faction he's with, and take a careful look at his equipment.
Ok, got it.

Wait, there's more. After you're done with the stalker, you need to go see a trader. His name is Toad, he recently settled at the Hills. You need to pick up a strange-looking container; it looks something like a small refrigerator. You'll need to bring it here. You'll get free treatment if you do this for me.
Who are you and where are you from?

Me? I'm Leary. I was part of a group of stalkers that was going from Shining Path to the Radar, and we decided to take a shortcut at the old military warehouses. But something's wrong there... If you go there, your brain gets cooked inside your skull. I don't remember how I got here. I recall seeing the destroyed bridge and having to swim...

I see you have nothing interesting on you. You've got a gun and a radio... The Doctor needs something, so he can take you in. He'll sell one of your things for money for medicine, while I'll be taking the other as payment.
Yeah, okay...
Hello, Toad. Doctor sent me.
You came from the swamps, eh? You're a tough one, Messer. I'll be honest, I didn't think you would last three days in the Zone, but here you are. Alright, here's the thing that Doctor wants.
Damn.. how much does this thing weigh?
Heh, did you think that it was made out of feathers? If you can't carry it, throw your stuff into the storage box, you can come back for it later. Don't worry about it, I'll keep your stuff safe.
Doctor, I brought what you asked for.
Good. I need you to do one more errand for me, and then I'll answer your questions.
Alright...

The stalker is getting better. He said that he came from the city with a group of people. Maybe he's a member of some faction? Go to Shining Path and ask around the local clan, maybe they know something.
Listen, have you ever heard about Leary?
Who? Ohhh, that guy. Yeah I know him. He disappeared along with a group at the Radar.
He's alive and currently is at the swamp Doctor.
Goddamn... and we already said goodbye to him, and now this... That's some good news! Well, tell the doc that we are extremely thankful. I think that the information he got there will be very useful.
I think I found the knife.
Yes, that's it! Thank you, you've helped me a lot.
You wanted to share information related to someone I'm looking for, right?

Alright... You're looking for Strelok, right? Long story short, I heard from some stalker at the bar who was wearing some worn-out coat that Strelok had stashes all around the Zone. He supposedly had one at Med-Pribor and here, in the Rostok underground. Our boys are currently diggin' there and it is possible that the part of the tunnel that was closed before is now accessible.
Is there any work you want done?

Yes. You need to find a knife in the Rostok underground that my friend lost. After you took care of that bloodsucker, stalkers began swarming the place looking for all kinds of shit. My friend was one of them and he lost the knife in one of the rooms.
I'll go take a look. What about payment?
I heard you're looking for someone. I think you'll find what I know useful. Bring me the knife, and we'll talk about it.
How are you, stalker? Were you the one who sent that SOS message?
Yes, I need help... Fuck, I barely escaped from that military base. There's no military there.. Those "people" there aren't even human!
What do you mean?

I was going to the Bar with some friends. They followed us... And somehow they knocked us out. We were taken to their base, and they impaled my friend Seryoga on a pole. Someone who looked like their leader performed some sort of a ritual... I can't forget that terrible sight. I still feel sick thinking about it.

The last PDA's last entry: - "Damn, the military is conducting a raid, and they're leaving no stone unturned." There is also information about the psy-installations at lake Yantar, the marshes, and Pripyat in the PDA's memory card. There are also mentions of a "Black Monolith" project, but detailed information is encrypted.
I think I found a group of scientists in the city.
What about them? Are they ok?
Well, no. They're dead. It seems that they hid in the attic of one of the houses when the city was being swept by military stalkers. Here, they had this PDA.
Well, okay. Thank you. Talk to our junior assistant. He might have some work for you... Damn it, our groups have had nothing but trouble lately.
Do you have any work for me?

Nah... Or wait, actually yeah, I do. A week ago a group of our men went to Shining Path to study some anomalies there and disappeared. I don't have anyone to send to rescue them, but you appear to be experienced. You'll need to find them, or their bodies, and find the results of their studies, if there any.
OK. I'll try to find them.
If you find anything bring it here, to the bunker.
Hey, take a look. It's this one, isn't it?
What? You... You found it?! Where?
One guy gave it to me. It doesn't matter. Take it. I see that this thing is very precious to you.
Stalker... I'm at a loss of words! Thank you! I'll tell the professor to let you in right away!
Greetings.
Huh? What do you want? The Professor isn't accepting visitors today. Turn around and get out of here!
Calm down, Barkeep sent me here. Why are you so nervous?

What?! Uh... she... she's gone, don't you get it?! She's completely gone... she disappeared in that damn lab in the Dark Valley! Ah, if I could only find the pendant that I gave her... A silver one...
Ok, I think this is the place.
Yup. Thanks for your help, Messer. Here's your suit, you've earned it.
Thanks.

Oh and by the way, you see that guy? That's the main assistant. He's a bit unhinged, so remember to treat him nicely. His wife died recently... She got a pendant from him some time ago, but they didn't find it near her body. She died in some lab at the Valley... Now he dreams of that pendant... Kinda creepy, huh? Anyways, once again, thanks for your help!
Greetings, Zyablikov? What's going on?
Hello. Listen, Messer, would you lead me to the camp? I can show you the way.
Alright, let's go.
Great! When we get there I'll give you one of the suits.
Here's the documents.
Uh huh... huh... I don't understand anything! What laboratory? He's alive? Why didn't nobody tell us? What is going on here?
Calm down, doc. What about my suit?
Sorry, I guess I got a bit carried away. It's time to go back to Yantar. Come to the mobile lab for your suit.
Greetings. What's that suit you're wearing? Did you get it from the eggheads?
Yes, it's a scientific suit. Fully waterproof. It can protect from even the worst chemical anomalies! Want one? I'll get you one if you do something for me.
What do you want?

Me and my brother used to work in the factory. His name was Vania. One time we got into an argument over a petty issue. I got really angry and ran away for a long time. When I finally came back, I learned that the entire complex was evacuated. But here's the catch - Vania didn't come back home. The administration tried to play us like a damn fiddle - they said that he either escaped, or died on duty. Basically, they lied like the devil. The entire family has gone nuts. Then I got a letter from the Research Institute with an offer to take part in an expedition to the Zone. More specifically - to protect it. I wanted to deny the offer, but I've heard that the complex is also in the Zone, and I have nothing to lose. Long story short - if you go to the Rostok plant and find anything that mentions my brother or maybe even him, I'll give you my suit. Are you up for it?
Hm... alright. I'll try to find something about him.
Do you have any jobs for me?
Yes, I do. Behind the Rostok plant, near the dam, is some sort of living area. A Kamaz truck sits there. I want it brought here, but nobody wants to do it.
I can try to do it.
I see that you're quite a brave stalker. Ok then. The Kamaz is waiting for you near the living complex. Bring it here, to the bar. Don't worry bout payment, I'll take care of it.
OK.
I brought the truck.
Great job, here's your reward. Is the truck alright? Does it have any cargo left inside? Or maybe something else happened?
No, everything is all right... Except, there was a bloodsucker... It probably came from Rostok..
Alrighty then. I'll get someone to put the truck at the 'parking lot'. Thanks for your help, Messer.
Greetings! Are you looking for new fighters?
You want to join our ranks? We're always searching for brave fighters like you!
Yes, I do!
If that's so, then we'll happily take you in! You are now officially a member of Duty! Here's your gear.
Glory to Duty!
Listen, I need some of your radioactive bolts. You got any?
Well, alright, why not. 1000 RU for 8 bolts.
Alright, here's the cash.
For that kind of price?! Have you gone mad?!
Hey, what are those boxes you got here? You've got all of these artifacts too.

Yeah, imagine this - some Freedomers in Rostok found 10 crates full of bolts! But these aren't regular bolts, they're radioactive bolts... Basically, this should've been brought outside the perimeter a long time ago, but there's some delays with the delivery and shit, so I'm keeping them safe. And about these artifacts - I managed to synthesize them some time ago. I had a portable transmutator, and I still have some recipes in my PDA. If you're interested, talk to our leader at the mobile bunker in Yantar.
Alright, good to know. Thanks.
I think I did it, Barkeep.

Hold on a second. Some stalkers brought someone from Radar. He seems to be... A bit insane. Still, I think we can get some useful information from him that might shed some light on what's going on over there.
Alright.
Barkeep, something's wrong with your guy.
Damn. Do you know what he's talking about?
It seems like that his brain is completely fried. I need a first-aid kit, he seems to be on his last legs.
Here you go. Try to get him to talk.
Alright.
Meeting with a psycho
Get information about the "Brain Scorcher" from Spotty
Get the first aid kit
Get the first aid kit from Barkeep
Give the first aid kit to Spotty
Talk to Baldy
Talk to Badly about Spotty
Talk to Spotty
Greetings, Barkeep. Is this what you're looking for?
Where did you get that from?! Hide it, quick! You don't show stuff like that around in front of everyone!
Listen, in there I saw...
Let's go to my office, we'll talk there.
Alright.
Your man is dead.
Damn.. was there anything else? Was he the only one who died?
A few Freedom-associated stalkers were killed. It seems to be the work of a Controller, and I think that Controller decided to follow me.
Well, in that case we'll have to do it ourselves. Some Freedomers gave us a tip about a potential stash location. Here, on the bar territory. These are the two places we need to check. Let's go.
Alright.
Hello. What do you need?
Stalker! You're alive. I don't know how you did it, but here you are. How's your head doing? Are you feeling okay?
Well, mostly. I am feeling a bit off, but I'm alive, and that's what counts. I don't think I'm going to become a zombie that's going to eat your brains anytime soon.

That's great. Let's get to the point: you plan on going to the center of the Zone, right? I've got something that might be of interest to you. Duty has an "Igla" missile launcher; in the Zone, these are extremely rare. Other stalkers want it, so they keep it under lock and key. If you do a certain job for Duty, you'll get it for free. You need to go to Rostok. There's a warehouse, and on the roof, there's a man from Duty there. Talk to him, and decide if you want to do the job. Simple enough, right? If you do it, the the reward will be worth it.
I see you're not the average stalker, Witcher. Alright, I'll go do it.
Hey. I'm back.
Hey, stalker. How's the situation there?
That place is inhabited by a couple of zombies and rats, but it's quiet.
Good.
But when I approached the Rostok exit, a Bloodsucker appeared. It looks like he followed me...
I see. Well, if it's like that, then I think we can get through to the factory.
What's the plan of action?
We need to get ready. We are waiting for the necessary equipment for now. When we are ready, I'll inform you. We might be at the factory waiting for you when I inform you.
Good morning, general!
What are you doing, stalker? Do you need something?
Hmm.. I do need something. That does explain why I'm here.
*awkward silence*
I think I should leave, hehe.
I have a couple of questions.
I'm listening.
How was your group formed?
Why are you at war with "Freedom"?

When one of the first major expeditions was sent to the Zone, which included scientists and a military detachment, no one at that time knew what the outcome would be. The expedition failed, and one of the military generals, General Tachenko, founded "Duty". Many of his comrades died, so he vowed to destroy the Zone, which he regarded as a plague. We have been following this ideology for a long time, and we are not going to retreat.
That's simple - their ideology opposes ours, and therefore, our interests do not coincide. In the Zone, we resolve our differences with force.
It's just that simple, right?
Did you expect me to explain to you why we're a just cause? What's the point? Everyone knows we're in open war with Freedom and that we don't take any chances.
Nevermind.
Okay. Well, I’m going.
Well, are you ready to go to the factory?
Yes. I notified Barkeep that we were going to Rostok. He said that there were a large group of mutants near the factory. Nevertheless, everything is ready. I think we can handle it.
Alright, let's go.
Let's get going.
Kill the Bloodsuckers
Listen, there's a bunch of Bloodsuckers behind the Rostok factory. People never go to there, but it's best if we get rid of them. Can you go kill them?
Kill the Bloodsuckers.
Kill the dogs
Listen, there's a herd of dogs near this parking lot. People never go to there, but it's best if we get rid of them. Can you go kill them?
Kill the dogs.
Kill the boars
Listen, there's a herd of wild boars at this hill. People never go to there, but it's best if we get rid of them. Can you go kill them?
Kill the boars.
I managed to get caught by a blowout at the Medpribor Institute. Do you mind telling me when the next one is going to happen?
You got lucky. That blowout wasn't very strong.
What? How? What do you mean by 'wasn't very strong'?

These weaker types of blowouts do happen, but they don't happen often. The last time one of those happened was when a group of veteran stalkers managed to break through to the center of the Zone. I can't predict when the next blowout will happen because my equipment is acting up. Until my equipment is fixed, I can't give out any guesses.
Find a "LR-300" for the Dutyer
Can you please get me a specific gun? I'm looking for a LR-300. We have plenty of unused grenade launchers and optical sights in storage. We need some shooters to put them on.
Find a "LR-300" for the Dutyer.
Find the "Disintegrator" artifact

A scientific research group has placed an order for the "Disintegrator" artifact. That artifact has strange properties that the majority of people don't understand, so traders don't pay much for them, but scientists are looking for them.
Find the "Disintegrator" artifact for the informant.
Find the "Mercury Ball" artifact

I'm thinking of going to on a raid to the Garbage. It's not far from here, but as you probably know, the anomalies and radiation is there in abundance. I don't want to use up my remaining anti-radiation meds there. If you get me a "Mercury Ball" artifact from there, or from someplace else, I'll make it worth your while.
Find the "Mercury Ball" artifact for the informant.
Find the "Mercury" artifact

I was sitting at the Duty camp in the Garbage, and I ran into a bunch of stalkers that had returned from a raid. One of them showed me something curious, and the stalker claimed he found it at the Radar. It was an artifact I've never seen before: a "Mercury". I asked him, "Where did you find it?", and he claimed that you can find them if you look hard enough. Can you find one for me? I'm amazed by how they look.
Find the "Mercury" artifact for the informant.
Find a "Colt M1911" pistol
Listen, I got an order here from one of our veterans. He wants an “Colt M1911". Those pistols are chambered for .45 ACP. Can you me one?
Find a "Colt M1911" pistol for the Duty trader.
Find a "Desert Eagle" pistol
Listen, I got an order here from one of our veterans. He wants an “Desert Eagle". Those pistols are chambered for .45 ACP. Can you me one?
Find a "Desert Eagle" pistol for the Duty trader.
Find a "USP" pistol
Listen, I got an order here from one of our veterans. He wants an “USP". Those pistols are chambered for .45 ACP. Can you me one?
Find a "USP" pistol for the Duty trader.
Kill the Bloodsuckers
Some Bloodsuckers came over to the forest to the east of the Duty outpost in Garbage. Apparently, they migrated from the Dark Valley. Destroy them.
Kill the Bloodsuckers
Find a "AIMS-74"

Have you seen the soldiers with those strange rifles? Rumors are going around that the Ukrainian government is buying rifles from Romania in bulk. Supposedly, they are quite lethal. I received an order one of those rifles. My sources tell me that only the soldiers carry them. Bring one and I'll exchange it for a new AK-74.
Find a "AIMS-74" for the informant.
Kill Digger

Listen, there’s this guy in the Cordon… He came with a group from the Garbage. Our people took them out, and he was their leader. Basically, I have information that he’s the only one who survived, and now, he seems to be hanging around on the farm. You need to take him out. The faster, the better.
Carry out the informant's hit on Digger.
Find the "Magnet" artifact
Listen, a friend of mine asked me to get an "Magnet" artifact. Could you get it for me?
Find the "Magnet" artifact for the informant.
Tell me about yourself.
What can I say? I am an ordinary stalker, and I go on raids into the Zone. You can see how well that went today, damn it. Sometimes I help Freedom with supplies or provisions, things like that.
Freedom?

Well, some dudes formed a group like Duty and settled down in the abandoned city. They’ve got a base there. They have snipers on the roofs holding the line against the zombies that have started to stream from Yantar. They’re decent guys, to be honest.
Is this your buddy?

Well.. holy shit. The raid is now postponed. Apparently this bastard came from the Rostok factory. People say that there's a whole mutant den over there. No one goes there, but those mutants manage to come here anyway.
What are you going to do?

I don't know, stalker. I'll try to find someone willing to go help raid the place... I'll probably stay here, or in the bar. For now, you should go about your business. I might have something for you later.
Yeah, ok.
Hello there! I haven't seen you around here before. I suppose you came here from the Garbage? Ha, ha! Of course you did! What a silly question. Listen, do you want to earn some money?
Sure. I could use some money.

I'll tell you what's going on. I had planned on going on a raid to the Medpribor Institute with someone - a newcomer. He agreed to carry a backpack with the loot for me while I watch our asses on the way back. I sent him to the apartment block opposite of mine so he could rest up while I go do some business during the night. I just woke up, but I haven't seen or heard from him. I'm worried. Do you want to help me check things out? I'll cover you in there if you decide to help.
Alright, let's go do it.
Sorry, I don't have the time for this.
Hey you, don't you get it?
Calm down, what is going on here?
This is your last warning, stalker!
Go to hell!
What ya need?
Ah, nothing. I'm just checking around. What's up with this stalker? He looks awful.
He's a rookie, came from the Garbage. He's new to the zone and he's not accustomed to the power of the local alcohol yet.
Heh, alright then.
I'd like to buy a car.

No problem. I've got several vehicles for sale.
 
Zaphorozets - 1000 rubles. It's a bit beaten up, but it works. It's in a garage on the Bar territory.
 
Moskvich - 2000 rubles. Some stalkers managed to bring this from Pripyat. It's nearly brand new! It's at Yantar in the car hangar. 
 
Kamaz - 8000 rubles. This is a biggie. It's a solid vehicle, and it has good handling. It's on Bar territory. 
 
Lada - 5000 rubles. You'll hit 130 on the road, but don't expect that kind of speed offroad. Also on Bar territory, in one of the garages. 
 
And the BTR - 15000 rubles. Don't ask where I got it from. It's on Bar territory. 
 
What do you choose? But first, show me that you've got enough money. If you don't have anything, then there's nothing to talk about.
Gimme the Zaphorozets.
I'll take the Moskvich.
Give me the Lada.
I think the Kamaz will work for me.
I want the BTR.
I've changed my mind. Maybe another time.
We need to talk.
What's up?
In the Dark Valley, right outside the lab, some guys in blue suits attacked me.
In blue suits? Hmmm... It looks like someone wants you dead! But who and why I won't tell because I don't know!
Alright. If you'll get some info - tell me!
Hey Barkeep, where did you get all this stuff you sell from?
Some of it is brought from outside the Zone, and the rest is brought by stalkers. We fix the stuff they bring and sell it.
Can I also repair my stuff here?
Sure!
That's cool, thanks.
Can you fix something?
Listen, a stalker is working off a debt for me, he's a good technician. He can fix anything - guns and stuff are his passion. So what are we repairing?\n \nPossible repairs:
Fix the weapon in the first slot.
Fix the weapon in the second slot.
Fix up the armor.
Crap, I'm low on cash. Maybe another time.
Here, all fixed up and ready to go!
Take it, it's all fixed up!
Like new! Your worker's great at this! Tell him I said thanks.
Great job, really!
Can he fix something else, too?
Of course, he doesn't have much to do these days!\n\Possible repairs:
Who's that dude in the corner, the one with the coat?
That's the Informer, what about him?
He's kinda strange...
Maybe he's a bit strange, but he knows a lotta things! Talk to him, you can get a lot of info out of him!
Thanks for the advice.
The job is done! The Scorcher is off!
Great work, Messer! Now the road to the center of the zone is open! How hard was it?
It was really hard, but I managed to do it.

Anyway, for what you did, we decided to throw together some money for a reward for you. Here you go... And by the way, some stalker wants to see you. He wanted me to tell you that he will be at the Cordon, in Toad's bunker. That is all.
Thanks.
I'm interested in some information.
Ask away! I'll answer, but not for free, obviously. One answer - 100 rubles.
Where is the Freedom base located?
What's up with the radiation at Yantar?
What is the "Sin" faction?
Do you know where is the Sin base located?
Do you know where I can find the Journalist?
I'm looking for some normal armor, do you have any suggestions?
Who's the Journalist?
Gimme a hundred and I'll talk.
Take it.
I'll see you later.
The Freedom base is located in the center of Shining Path. You can get there from the Silent Hills or from Yantar.

It's psi-radiation, generated by an installation in the central complex. You can turn it off only in a lab hidden under the lake. The Yantar territory is very dangerous, one wrong step and you'll lose your mind!

These guys have a dark past. Nobody knows where they're from, but some say that they're people who were in the perimeter at the time of the Second Incident. They rarely talk to anyone, most of the time they'll just kill and feed mutants with the corpse.
In the Silent Hills, on the territory of the old army base.
Last time he was seen on the roof of some house close to the Freedom base.
Search around on the Garbage, if nobody already found it that is, he-he... I won't give back the money by the way. You asked for info - you got it.

An experienced stalker. He came to the zone to get info about some event. In the past he was often seen by stalkers, but now nobody knows where he is. He worked with a stalker called Strelok, probably hired him as a bodyguard or something.
I don't feel so good, mind healing me up?
You give me some food and I'll help ya.
I've got some bread, here.
I can share a sausage with you.
I've got some canned goods.
I've got nothing.
Alright, sew up here... use some gel here... bandage this... All done! You're good as new!
Okay, I'll help you for free for the first time. Alright, sew up here... use some gel here... bandage this... All done! You're good as new!
What do you do here, Doctor?
I help everyone who needs help, if they deserve it, of course.
That thing in the other room, is that your patient? Jeez...

For you stalkers - yes. That's why when you kill everything that moves, you hurt yourself to some extent. When killing a being, I advise you to think if that pain won't come back to you one way or another.
I'll try.
Why did you come to the Zone?
Unlike many I came here for knowledge and not money.
Well, what do you live off of, then?
In gratitude for my help, people bring me necessary things.
Oh, okay.
Why are the mutants friendly to you?
The Black Monolith can do a lot more than that...
The Black Monolith?!

Yes, the Black Monolith. It really exists, but it does the wishes not exactly the way we would want them to be done. I won't say anything else on this topic, you will learn everything yourself with time.
Alrighty...
Did you want to see me?

Yes, I've got something for you. One of our guys said that you were the one who killed the bloodsucker at Rostok. Great job, by the way. Anyway, I've got a job for you to do in that factory. You need to find a journal. You remember that stalker you found in the underground? Well, he was supposed to do that, but as we both know he didn't make it.
Alright, I'll try to find that journal.
Greetings stalker, are you new here?
Yes, I recently came here from the Cordon.
Look, I don't have time to chat right now. Come here later, or I will call you myself.
Ahh... shit... bloodsucker... help me, stalker!
Hold on.
Gimme a medkit. Duty will be grateful for you.
Who are you?
What? And who are you? Look, I'm tired. I'm too tired to chat, I just came back from a raid. Come later, we'll talk.
Alright then.

Greetings, Messer. I am a stalker from the Clear Sky faction. We aren't that great in numbers, so we work with loners. If you want to help us, come to the central complex of the Med-Pribor institute. Our guys are there. Help of someone like you will be of great use to them.
Clear Sky? That's the first time I hear about a faction like that. Alright, I'll meet with your people when the opportunity arrives.
Thank you, Messer.
Were you the one who sent me that message?
Yes. In all honesty, we automatically write off people like you. Mutants love fresh stalker meat. But I see that in your case it won't be that easy for them.
I have a job to do.
Hmm... what are you talking about?
I'm looking for a part of some documents. According to my information, it should be located in this place.

Yes, it is here. I can give it to you, but at a cost. You'll do some dirty jobs for me and you'll get your papers. Behind the base, near the entrance to the Bar some stalkers banded together. They're planning something. You must sneak up on them and figure out what they're planning, then you have to take them out.
Crap... Alright. I hope you'll keep your word.
Alright, go now, stalker.
Greetings, Barkeep.
Hello, Messer! How are ya? Are you alright? Is your brain fried?
Everything seems okay. The installation is off, there is no more psi-radiation at the lake.

Great. Listen: according to the documents you brought from the Dark Valley laboratory, it seems that the Yantar installation generated a psi-field covering some other territory. Another, more powerful antenna: Duga-1, protecting the road to the north. In theory the road to that antenna is now clear.
Go on...

On the Radar territory there is an entrance to an underground complex. Probably that's where the Duga-1 controls are located. You'll need to get down to that complex and turn off that thing. Then, the road to the north will be open.
Hmmm...okay.
Also, there is a car parked outside the bar. It's old, of course, but I think it will be useful. Here, take the keys.
Greetings, stalker.
Do you know who am I? Just don't tell me that the entire rumor with Messer - A.K.A me - came to you too.
Who's Messer? I don't know any Messer. I know my work and I can always recognize it. Hmm, that scar behind your ear... does it hurt, does it itch?
The only thing that itches me is my memory, or rather the lack thereof...
Well, I guess that's what happens after the Monolith.
To hell with the Monolith! Doctor, do you know who I am?!
Obviously. You were previously called Strelok. Listen, I can't help you enough to make your memories come back. You need to find the Journalist. He will answer all your questions.
What!? I am Strelok?!
I've got the documents.

Great! Show them to me. Hmm... there is info in them about psi-installations located in the northern part of the zone. It looks like they are the obstacle. And there is also a mention that the scientists from Yantar were responsible for delivering parts and supplying these antennas.
Scientists? What are they doing there?
God only knows, they're apparently doing some experiments. I think you should talk to them.
Okay, I'll go to Yantar.

Remember that there are many psionic hotspots scattered around there. If you don't want to fry your brain, keep away from the central complex. By the way, you're going to Yantar... Take this artifact merger. Let it be a reward for those documents from the lab. Just know that there are no recipies saved in the memory. If you want any, you should ask the scientists.
Alright. How do I get to Yantar?

The road to Yantar is located here, at the Bar. It's that long road. When you leave the bar, immediately take the road to the south west. That's how you'll get to the lake. Also, don't forget about necessary equipment, otherwise you won't last long.
Are you the Barkeep? Toad sent me to you with these documents.

Greetings, Messer. I haven't finished listening to the latest news about a Death Truck survivor who screwed up the military, but it turns out he's already here. Heh. Anyways, you're at the "Stalker" bar. This place is the "hub" of the Zone. Here you can rest and chat with other stalkers. Anyways, show me what you've got.
So, what is in those documents?

Mhm... there's some blueprints and calculations. There's also a mention of some laboratory, hidden under the Dark Valley. It looks like some kind of experiments took place there... Listen, I think you will need to find that place and find more documents. What you brought isn't enough.
You want me to go down to a laboratory?
Yes, it looks like there's no other way. It is clearly said in the documents that the laboratory is hidden under the Valley.
Well If I have to go I'll go.

Messer, that Valley... that place... Stalkers rarely go there. I recommend getting a lot of ammunition, nobody knows what's waiting for you there. The entrance to the Dark Valley is located in the eastern part of the Garbage. Two paths lead there. Good luck to you, Messer.
Do you have any special jobs for me? I heard that some bloodsuckers have appeared here as of late.

Yup, there's one thing. You need to find and kill a bloodsucker in the Rostok factory. It appeared there some time ago. I'll have you know that we're trying to kill it for a long time, but our efforts have so far been in vain. Many stalkers have lost their lives because of that leech. If you kill it then payment is guaranteed.
I'll take care of it.
I think I'll pass.
The sucker is dead.

Messer, damn me, you're alive! I can't believe that you killed that foul beast! I have a reward for you. Do you know where Duty has their headquarters? Across their base is a house. The stalker who occupied it disappeared a long time ago, I haven't heard of him in years. Here, take the key, you can live there. I haven't been in that house since it's owner disappeared, either way I don't need it and you've done a great thing. Take it. Ah, I've almost forgot: the leader of Duty wants to see you.
A house? Interesting. Alright, thanks.
Find and kill the Rostok bloodsucker
Barkeep: How's the house? No ghosts bothering you? I'm joking, of course. I forgot to mention that the house has a safe inside it. You can keep your stuff in there.
Listen, I am looking for someone. Name's Strelok. Do you know him?

Strelok... Yes, I know something. I saw him and his crew at Med-Pribor once. Rumor has it he's gone missing. Some say that he disappeared near the power plant, others say that he disappeared behind it. I don't know exactly. It's kind of a weird thing with that Strelok guy...
Thanks.
SOS Signal. Somebody, help me! Quick!
Quick! I'm under the complex!
This is the leader of Freedom. Talk to the trader on the 2nd floor, he has a job for you. We will talk later.
Greetings, who are you?
And who are you? We are a group of people with the same beliefs and interests. Some kind of clan. We organize raids together, raids that help everyone, kind of a friend self-help. This is our base.
Okay. What are your beliefs and interests?

Artefacts, of course! You can't do anything without them. And documents. You know, there are lots of laboratories in the Zone and there are tons of documents inside them. They are worth quite a lot of money.
Alright, see you.
Is there any work you want done?
Yes, there is. You need to bring me a TOZ-34.
Okay. Where do I look?
In the house nextdoor.
I'll look for it..
Go on...

So, your first fight? Your opponent is a piece of meat just like you. He's here because of debts and he only has two options: to come out and fight or to land himself in the nearest anomaly. He's gonna fight like a cornered animal. Equipment for today... lemme think... OK! Why don't you two use PMm's...two clips each should be plenty. Either you kick his arse or we feed you to the dogs - not much of a choice. Go on now.
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Your last fight didn't mean shit. You're still the same piece of meat you were before and no self-respecting person will bet a single mag on you. If you wanna earn some proper cash you're gonna have to make a few more appearances in the arena. Your new opponent also got through the first round and his fight was a lot harder than yours. I don't like him, to be honest - he kills too quickly and the crowd doesn't like that. So, go and show us what you can do! The stakes will increase after this fight - all you gotta do is stay alive. Move it!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Well, well... You're not as much of a pussy as you first seemed. Now it's time to test you out in a real fight. You're up against two guys. The first one's called Swede and I don't remember the second one's name. They were paired up intentionally as they hate each other's guts so don't worry about them working as a team - they're more likely to shoot each other. Today is rifle day so don't let them get too close or we'll have to pick you up piece by piece. The odds are ten to one so if you win you'll make a fair amount. Off you go!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Well, now I can safely say that you're a fighter, a real fighter. Now it's time for a team fight. You get to fight with two rookies - two brothers - on your side. They haven't fought yet but they're brothers, so I had to put them into a team fight. I wouldn't expect any real help from them if I were you. You're fighting an experienced team, they're contenders for the final this season. A dangerous lot. They use different weapons but one has an automatic shotgun - be very careful with him. Good luck, pal... you're gonna need it.
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

You've got a special fight today. Even the army has heard about you! Don't be surprised, they fight here too - there's even a general in the crowd. These guys are from the Spetsnaz or from OMON. They're well armed and their armor is good as you'd expect. Don't worry though, I ain't gonna leave you out in the rain, either. You'll get a vest used by Freedom - it's light so it won't slow you down. Go on, show them that stalkers ain't no whipping boys. Good luck!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Time for you to show what you can do. Duty captured a group of bandits that had been causing problems for stalkers near Rostok. Duty took 'em at night so most of the bandits were taken alive. They were all gonna be executed anyway so I convinced Duty to give them a chance. If any of them survive, they'll go in the can outside the Zone, which is better than dying here. They're not well-armed - just a few pistols and sawn-offs - but there's six of them so watch yourself. Go on now!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Well, you're almost in the final. Now you'll be fighting a real stalker. He's alone but he's got an FN2000 and he's inside an exoskeleton. Catch one burst and you're toast. There will be a surprise that I can't tell you about too... Here's my advice: be prepared, it's gonna be tough. The winner makes it through to the final. Fight to the death, go!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Congratulations, you're in the final! One more to go and this one is to the death, every man for himself. There will be four other stalkers in the arena: all real pros in exoskeletons with H&K G36s but it's a fair deal this time - you'll get exactly what they have. The only thing is, you don't get medkits or bandages in a fight to the death. Ready? Go prove you're the best, GO!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.
Yo! I've got a new fight for you.
Go have a drink or something. The Arena ain't ready yet.
You've already become a pro!!!\nThere are no fighters good enough for you here, that's why I propose you should fight on the other arena - with mutants!
You won! Here's your reward.
You're not experienced enough for this fight.
Greetings! I've got a new mutie for you. Want to fight him?
What are you waiting for? Get in the cage.
Sorry, there's nothing to fight right now. Wait a day or two, we should catch a new mutant by then.
That's my boy! Here's your reward. If you want to fight for money again, come again.
Sorry bro, but you've lost. Come again next time if you want.
Pussy!
I want to fight. Who's the opponent?
There is nobody to fight right now. Come later when Duty will deliver a new shipment of mutants.
There's a pseudodog. Quite a big one. A bit beaten up, but mad as my mother-in-law! Be thankful you've never seen her...
I'll try. Let your mother, I mean dog, out.
Nah, I won't fight a dog.
Our little girl is too scared to fight a doggie. Alright, don't get mad, just banter. He-he.
I've got some thing in a gasmask. They call it a snork. On the outside - skinny and frail, but really fucking athletic.
Gimme that snork of yours.
No, I won't fight a snork.
You scared of being beaten by some weirdo in a gasmask?
You're lucky. We just caught a young bloodsucker. He's kinda dumb, but he's got all the bad traits of an adult one.
Gimme that sucker.
Nah I don't want to fight a bloodsucker.
Yeah, that's what I thought.
We've got a dwarf in a hood - a burer.
Gimme that thing.
Nah, I won't fight a burer.
He barely reaches your crotch, and you're scared of him?
This is a special case. I don't know where they caught this one, but they just call him "Beast".
Give me that Beast of yours.
Nah, that sounds too scary even for me.
I'm scared of him too, but I'm not the one who fights on the Arena. So who's the real wuss?
Payment to take part in a fight - 1000 rubles.
Here.
I don't have any cash.
And you again without any money...
2000 rubles for participation.
Here.
No cash, sorry.
Go away then.
3000 rubles and the bloodsucker's yours.
Here.
I'm empty, sorry.
Don't joke, even my little son has that much cash.

Ñ Äîëãîì äîãîâîðèëèñü. Ðàíüøå îíè íà çà÷èñòêàõ äîáèâàëè âñåõ, à ïîòîì ÿ ïðåäëîæèë èì äåíüãè â îáìåí íà ðàíåíûõ îñëàáëåííûõ ìóòàíòîâ. Äîãîâîðèëèñü áûñòðî. Ñ òåõ ïîð ó ìåíÿ ïðàêòè÷åñêè íåèññÿêàåìûé èñòî÷íèê æèâûõ ìóòàíòîâ. À èç òåë ÿ ïîòîì ÷ó÷åëà äåëàþ, è çà ïðåäåëàìè Çîíû ïðîäàþ. Ïîëüçóþòñÿ áîëüøîé ïîïóëÿðíîñòüþ.
Îòêóäà òû?

Îòêóäà ÿ? Ìíîãî îòêóäà. ß óæå è ñàì íå çíàþ, ÷òî ñ÷èòàòü ñâîåé ðîäèíîé. Äîëãîå âðåìÿ ïðîâ¸ë â Àôðèêå, ïîòîì íåñêîëüêî ëåò â Ýêâàäîðå. À ïîòîì óñëûøàë î òàêîì çàìå÷àòåëüíîì ìåñòå è ïîíÿë, ÷òî çäåñü ìîæíî õîðîøî çàðàáîòàòü.
Êàêèå ïðàâèëà?

Î, ïðàâèëà î÷åíü ïðîñòûå. ß èõ ñàì ïðèäóìàë. Åñòü êëåòêà, â íå¸ çàïóñêàåòñÿ ìóòàíò. Òû ïëàòèøü äåíüãè, à òàêæå âûáèðàåøü âðåìÿ, çà êîòîðîå òû óáü¸øü ìîíñòðà. Åñëè óñïåâàåøü - ïîëó÷àåøü âûèãðûø. Åñëè íå óñïåâàåøü - äåíüãè ÿ îñòàâëÿþ ñåáå. Åñëè òû óìð¸øü - îáåùàþ ïîõîðîíèòü ñî âñåìè ïî÷åñòÿìè. ×åì ìåíüøå âðåìÿ, êîòîðîå òû âûáåðåøü - òåì áîëüøå âûèãðûø.
Here is the flash drive professor Kruglov gave me.
Good boy. I think Duty will be very grateful for this info. Here is your reward.

Well, well. Information? Straight from professor Kruglov? You taking the piss or what? "I am professor Kruglov and I am deleting reports about our research for the sake of science and humanity..." And this is the info you were supposed to get!? Well, shit...I'm sure Duty will be "happy" about this.

Well, well. Information? Straight from professor Kruglov? È îäíîâðåìåííî ó âñåõ àíàðõèñòîâ Ñâîáîäû â ðàäèóñå 10 êèëîìåòðîâ??? What, do you take me for an idiot? Well, shit...I'm sure Duty will be "happy" about this.
I accomplished my mission. Here is Tyran's PDA.
Wow, Marked One! Great job! What can I say? You made me happy, man. I wasn't sure you'd manage, to be honest...but you're alive and they're not!
What about my reward?
Here. Your reward as promised.
Here is Lucky's PDA. I did what you asked.
Nice, Marked One. Great job! What can I say? You made me happy, man. I wasn't sure you'd manage, to be honest...but you're alive and they're not!
What about the reward?
You're a hero, man, a real hero. Here, that should make you happy.
ß âûïîëíèë òâî¸ çàäàíèå. Äåðæè ÊÏÊ âîåííîãî.
À âîò è íàãðàäà.
Ðàáîòà äëÿ ìåíÿ íàéä¸òñÿ?
Íåò, ñåãîäíÿ íè÷åãî íåò.
Åñòü ðàáîòà, íî òîëüêî äëÿ âåòåðàíîâ.
Áëèæå ê äåëó. ×òî íóæíî ñäåëàòü?
Èçâèíè, íå áóäó ïîêà áðàòüñÿ.

Äåëî òàêîå, íà "Äèêîé òåððèòîðèè" àíàðõèñòû ñáèëè âåðòîë¸ò ñ ó÷¸íûìè. Óöåëåâøèõ, âêëþ÷àÿ ïðîôåññîðà Êðóãëîâà, îêðóæèëè. Áóäóò ëè áîåâèêè Ñâîáîäû àòàêîâàòü ó÷¸íûõ, åñëè íå "äîãîâîðÿòñÿ", íåèçâåñòíî. Êðóãëîâ â¸ç î÷åíü âàæíóþ èíôîðìàöèþ, å¸ íàäî ïîëó÷èòü, âî ÷òî áû òî íè ñòàëî, è îíà íå äîëæíà ïîïàñòü ê àíàðõèñòàì.
Ýòî âñ¸?

What do you know about Strelok?

An experienced stalker as far as I know. He used to "work" through the northern exits from the Zone. He was hardly ever seen here but there are rumours that he took his group right into the center of the Zone.

Strelok and his crew tried to find out more about the Zone, but he and his entire crew disappeared. I don't know the truth, I only can guess. Government organisations put mobile laboratories around the Zone, isolated metallic bunkers protected by stalkers. These bunkers are self sufficient and able to work for a couple of months on their own. We keep in touch with one of these bunkers at Yantar. The eggheads are pretty okay guys, they'll share some info, and we help them in times of need. Works for both of us.
What is the wish granter?
Oh! That's an interesting question... I wish I knew the answer. I can tell you the legend about the Granter if you want but you make up your own mind how much truth there's in it. Wanna hear it?
Well, that's very interesting.

This legend is about the Monolith, which may be what caused the Zone to appear. When the Zone exploded in 2006, they evacuated people living near it and the Zone itself was cordoned off by the Army. Everyone was panicking, nobody knew what was going on, the Zone was expanding and the field labs couldn't do anything! Loads of people died there. Everyone was afraid of the radiation which could affect half of Europe. After a few years had passed, some reckless guys like you appeared. They called themselves stalkers. They started to sneak past army cordons believing that there are things in the Zone that would make them rich. Bit by bit, they brought out weird things, artifacts and which eventually turned out a race for them. Scientists went after them like crazy. They paid fantastic money for just one trinket back then, not like now.
Go on...

After a while, the first tales and legends about what's deep inside the Zone by the tumbledown nuclear power plant started to circulate. It was also then that one of the veterans told us the story of Monolith that allegedly grants your wishes. You should have seen the hysteria: experienced, level-headed men started trying to break through to the center - everyone wanted something from the Monolith. We got some morbid details about the first stalker who made it through to the Monolith...
Go on... tell me more.

When the Zone had just appeared many people were trapped inside and cut off from the outside world. Most of them died pretty quickly but there were a few lucky survivors who tried to do something about it. One of these survivors found himself by the station and noticed some strange light inside. With no way back he decided to try to get closer. He saw the broken roof of the sarcophagus and the light coming out through it. He climbed up the wall and looked inside. Among the debris of metal and molten concrete there lay a massive black rock. It was the Monolith. The stalker managed to shake off the "spell" and realised that he had climbed very close to the sarcophagus, which was highly radioactive. He was scared to death but through the fear he could sense the Monolith calling to him. The Monolith called to him and he came to see strange, unbelievable things about the Monolith inside his head...
Cool...

I don't know what's true in this story and what's not but the point is the guy made a wish which came true, while the Zone grew by 5 kilometers. It seems the Zone gobbles up more land for every wish that is granted... But that ain't gonna stop hotshots like you. They keep trying to break through with their precious little wishes in their hearts...
I'm interested in some information.
Alright then. What are you interested in?
I brought the docs from the lab, here.

That's my boy, good job. It's great to have you alive. Alright, let's take a look... something about experiments, some calculations, some scientific babble, grams... Crap, I don't understand any of this. But don't worry, we'll find the answer soon. Here, you can consider this your reward.
What now?
I need at least half an hour to read all of this. Come later, we'll talk.
OK.
I'm back. The job is done.
Wait, wait. Let's go to my room. Too many people here.
Ok, let's go.
Here it is, the work of the greatest minds of the eastern block! Here, hold this.
Are you joking? Wait, i need to decode these papers, read all of it and think about it. You did a great job. I feel like it will help us a lot in defeating the Scorcher. Come here after half an hour.
OK.
I took care of the sniper, here's his PDA.

Oh, damn. Thank you friend, you saved my ass. I owe you one. Here, for you, new generation detector. You see, life is a long play and without help you won't get a happy ending. You help me, I help you, we won't die together.
Just remember to not be drunk when I need your help.
What ya need?

What I need? Hm... You need to kill one son of a bitch! A sniper recently popped up here, he comes out at night and starts shooting people. He's smart, he can tell when someone's out to get him. He instantly runs away, leaving no traces behind. He appears around the water tower, I sent you his spot to your PDA. I can't do this on my own. I'm a Dutyer, so Freedom will quickly take care of my ass if I try to do anything. Help me.
I'll try.

Thank you. You'll get me the documents of that sucker, and I will give you this detector. I swear on my life! But you... eh, nevermind, no unnecessary questions. Don't forget: the sniper appears at midnight and dissapears when the first rays of the sun begin to shine.
Nah, I don't want to take care of this right now.
Crap. What am I supposed to do? Nobody wants to help me.
Our goal - elimination of mutants. Especially zombies. Hic!... You can join our ranks. But first you need to prove your dedication to the clan.
I understand.
What's up? Any news? You haven't whacked the little piece of shit, I can see it in your eyes. Life sucks... Listen, at least have a drink with me, will you, friend?
What's up man? Any news?
Hic... you helped, yes. Come here, let's drink for Duty, eh? Eh!
I found it. Here is your rifle.

Thanks. I'm so grateful! You really helped me out there, you really did. Goddamn. Here take this - it ain't much but it's all I got. I won't forget your help and I hope to repay you in time. Íó òåïåðü ÿ ýòèõ ñâîëî÷åé ïîñòðåëÿþ âñåõ, ýòî òî÷íî.
Go on.
I'll give you anything! Just return my rifle, I beg you. Be careful though. Those zombies aren't the friendly kind.
OK, I'll try.
I won't cheat you.
OK.
No. I've got more important things to do.
Up to you... but I hope you change your mind.
We'll see.

I've got a big problem man! I... I lost my rifle. I wanted to shoot some bloodsuckers but I barely got away. Damn! Listen, bro... if you get it back I'll pay you. I've grown used to it, it's like an extension of my arm now... It's here near the Bar, by the Rostok factory. In one of the houses. When I was getting out through a window, I had to drop it along with my backpack...
Hey! Any news? Did you find it?!
Thanks bro'! I'll never forget that you helped me!
Are you not interested in the map of Shining Path?
For 10000 rubles.
Here's your map.
Maybe another time.
Wolfhound said you've got something for me.
Sure. Here is a grenade launcher for helping him with Kruglov, and 1000 cash on top. I'll give you some useful info for free to sweeten the deal too.
Thank you.

Here's what I got to say. You helped Freedom and made the right choice. Your fate is now tied with that of Freedom, and Duty has you in its sights. I'd say you oughtta go to the abandoned military base and join the ranks of Freedom - they need good fighters. There will be shootouts between the groups soon and whoever chooses the right side won't regret it.
I work as a dealer of information. I sell important info, and I can tell you some interesting rumors. My information is valuable and very useful to the one who possesses it!

Hello, Marked One. You helped Freedom and made the right choice. Your fate is now tied with that of Freedom and Duty has you in its sights. I'd suggest you go to the abandoned military base and join Freedom - they need good fighters.
I'll think about it.
So Messer, what brings you here? Wanna buy some info or are you selling today?
So you're connected with Freedom then?
I can't answer that question right now. All I can say is that I am not a member of any group.
Tell me about the Freedom faction.

Sure, no problem! Freedom is one of the oldest groups in the Zone and the only one that openly opposes government troops and research teams. Its founders are dead - they were killed during a big bloodbath after the army dropped a large assault force in the Zone but the ability to control the Zone from outside was destroyed at the same time. There is some evidence to suggest that the first Zone was used as a secret army weapons' testing site . If that's true, they must have used some powerful shit.Anyway, what was I saying...? Oh yeah, Freedom is the only group that is trying to stop the government from gaining control over the testing site again. God knows what will happen if they start testing their shit again, so Freedom is trying to hold out at all costs.
Åñëè "Ñâîáîäà" õî÷åò óäåðæàòü âîåííûé ïîëèãîí â ñâîèõ ðóêàõ, then what about Duty?

Duty is basically controlled from the outside by the government. Their current objective is to clear the territory of mutants and destroy Freedom, which is what they are doing at the moment. When the time is right, they will drop a large assault force in the Zone and take control of the area.
Man, that sounds scary. Thanks for the information.
I want to buy some information.
Right now, I can sell you information about Strelok's group virtually for nothing - 400 roubles.
OK, I'll take it. Here's 400.
It's located by the MedPribor Research Institute, there's a stash in the underground. It probably contains information about the group's plans and a list of group members.
No, I changed my mind.
Up to you. Come to the bar when you decide otherwise - I'm always here.
Right now, I have some information about a group that made it to the center of the Zone. I'm practically giving it away - only 200 roubles.
OK, I'll buy it. Here's 200.

Strelok along with his group got to the center of the Zone. What they found there is unknown, one thing we do know is that Strelok disappeared. I've heard that the Journalist knows what's up with him.
No, I changed my mind.
Up to you. Come to the bar when you decide otherwise - I'm always here.
I've got some information about the secret of Lake Yantar. The price is just 350 roubles - any less and I'd be paying you!
Okay, I'll buy. Take 350.

The secret of Lake Yantar is similar to the secret of the Brain Scorcher and their effects are similar in many ways. Some kind of emission zombifies all who come in contact with it. The zombified stalkers move around the center of some emitter, attacking everyone. There is information to suggest that the solution to the riddle of Lake Yantar is in the lower levels of the Dark Laboratory. Here are the coordinates of the emitter at Lake Yantar and those of the Brain Scorcher. As a bonus, I'll give you the coordinates to the Dark Laboratory.
No, I changed my mind.
Up to you. Come to the bar when you decide otherwise - I'm always here.
I have no new information right now.
I want to buy info about the stash with armor and stuff.
2000 rubles.
Take it.
The armor stash is located at the Garbage, in a small forest where wild dogs live.\nHere are the coordinates.
I need information about people. Bios, contacts, connections and all that.
Currently I have info about these people:
Toad

Íåò, ÿ ïåðåäóìàë.
...it's about time someone whacked Borov! If I knew who it was, I'd buy him a drink.
Yeah, it was about time.
...someone really pissed off Freedom: I heard one of their groups was destroyed in the Wild Territory...I wonder who did it?
Yeah, I wish I knew...
...finally someone had the balls to clear out the bloodsuckers in the Wild Territory... What was Duty doing all this time?
What was Duty doing? They were doing Freedom, what else?
...I heard someone whacked the leader of Freedom. They're in for some tough times I think. Duty is gonna really put a squeeze on 'em...
Let's hope so.
So you wiped out those veterans? Well done, friend! Six stalkers went missing in that area recently...we all suspected those mad veterans. It's a good thing that they've been dealt with.
Yeah, many people wanted those veterans to "leave".

You turned off the emissions at Yantar? Wow...you're a lucky nut, damn it, I'm glad that someone finally managed to deal with that thing! You can't imagine how many of our boys died there... but now the scientists will work out what it was. We might even be able to deal with the Scorcher now...
I want to believe that the Scorcher can be switched off.
What do you want? Don't you see, I'm trying to relax here...
What's new?

I hear Strelok came back. He's got all the equipment you need to get to the Machine... He's hiding now though 'cause a lot of people are after him. Some are open about it while others are trying to keep their interest a in secret. Rumour has it even Duty and Freedom have joined the hunt... each with their own agenda.
Looks like Strelok is right to hide.
What do you want?
Can you tell me anything that would be useful to a rookie?

Useful to a rookie? Well, listen up. To the North, not far from the Brain Scorcher, Freedom have set up their HQ in an old military base. They're notorious nihilists, anarchists and criminals - freedom fighters, freaking guerrillas all of them. All they do is sabotage research groups, attack army units and constantly skirmish with Duty. These skirmishes are now spilling over into a small-scale war for survival. Let me give you some advice: never get involved with them. They'll only accept you if you're totally crazy and there's a reward on your head. Ha-ha-ha. Can you believe that?
Thanks for your advice.
What do you want?
Can you tell me anything that would be useful to a rookie?

Well, there used to be this group led by Strelok. There were all sorts of legends about it going around the Zone...good and bad, but few people really knew the truth. The truth is that they wanted to deal with the Zone, find out what created it. That's why military stalkers were after them but they didn't know where to look. The government didn't want normal stalkers to know things they shouldn't have known. One day Strelok found something really important and made a move towards the center of the Zone with some of his boys. Half of the group died on the way but the rest made it through... What happened to them there - no one knows. Looks like they've copped it. The other group members were caught and killed off... I don't think there are any of them left now. Sad story, eh?
Yeah... looks like someone really doesn't want the Zone to be understood...
What do you want?
Can you tell me anything that would be useful to a rookie?

Mercs are kinda like Freedom, only worse. At least Freedom have some ideals, but these dogs, they'll do anything for money. Someone really needs to kill 'em all before they drag something really dangerous out of the Zone into the normal world! They're based in Shining Path and there's a sniper in every tall building, understand? They're not keen on strangers.
I see. Looks like you have to be careful in Shining Path.
What do you want?
Can you tell me anything that would be useful to a rookie?

If you haven't been in the Arena, I'd recommend it - it's a good way to make money and show everyone what you can do. Not everyone has the balls to fight the next monster and that's a pity! Man, as soon as I save up enough cash for decent armor, I'm there.
What do you want?
Are you Baldy? I need to talk to you.
Suppose I am. What do you want?
Spotty got saved from the Red Forest, but Hunchback is dead.
Dammit!
Spotty is in bad shape, his brain doesn't work anymore. Maybe you can talk to him? We need to find out the Scorcher's schedule.

No! Don't ask me to do this. Hunchback is dead 'cause of me and what happened to Spotty is my fault too. I left them, betrayed them, deserted them and ran away! I can't look Spotty in the eyes after what I did!
C'mon, chill man. Tell me what happened.

The three of us were getting ready to try to get through to the North. We didn't know when the Scorcher emissions were lower but Spotty managed to get the info somewhere...I don't know where... We were half-way through the sector, when the Scorcher suddenly switched on again. Spotty passed out straight away and fell down the hillside. I panicked and said that we should leave everything and go back. Hunchback managed to pull himself together and said that we had to get Spotty out... I said "You're an idiot, don't you wanna live? It's over for him, how are we gonna carry him all the way back?" Just as he managed to convince me and started to climb down to get Spotty... another wave came. By the time I came to my senses I was by the military base... I thought Hunchback and Spotty stayed there... but Hunchback got him out and didn't make it himself... he got him out...
OK, Baldy, OK. Calm down, man. Thanks for telling me what happened. I'll talk to Spotty myself.
Sorry. I'm not in the mood for talking... I'd rather just have another drink.
What do you want?
What's new?

There was a guy... He had a lisp and walked with a stoop so he got the name Hunchback. He was a bit crazy...talked to himself and to animals... but apart from that, he was alright. He disappeared a long time ago in the center with Strelok... they say Strelok is back now.
I wonder where he is now.
What do you want?
What can you tell me?

The Rostok factory is infested with bloodsuckers now! They come out at night. I heard there's something really important at the factory that's nearby, something essential to someone. Duty sent some guys in there recently but they all died and their screams were heard kilometers away.
Thanks for the information.
What do you want?
What did you hear?

If you go around Lake Yantar you'll come to the scientists' camp - they're do research of some sort there... They were dropped in by helicopter and they get regular supplies too. They've got a nice spot there really... You can deal with them too - they buy artifacts and might even give you a job to do.
Thanks for the information.
What do you want?
What did you hear?

Nobody has managed to get through the vehicle scrapyard because of the Brain Scorcher. Some people did see a stalker go through the invisible border, fall over, then get up in a couple of minutes and head straight for the center of the scrapyards. He ain't been seen since...
Interesting...
What do you want?
What did you hear?

Missing stalkers come back from time to time. It's a scary sight, I tell you: they mumble something and reach for their weapons, which they lost somewhere... One came to a Duty outpost some time ago and a crowd gathered to look at him. Someone even recognized him... He was scary...red eyes, all bloodshot and bruised...couldn't say a word, just moaned like an animal and went around in circles. Duty took him in, but he died after a couple of days anyway. Something happens to people in the Zone, but what is it?
I'd like to know too.
What do you want?
What did you hear?

There are a lot of zombies around Lake Yantar. They wander around and attack any human they see. If you're spotted you might wanna run for your life - there are too many of them former stalkers around there... They died at the lake and that's all that's left of 'em.
Yeah, I wouldn't want to join them.
What do you want?
What did you hear?

Traders say that there's a real treasure trove of artifacts in the center of the Zone, so anyone who makes it through will make enough money for two lifetimes. Personally, I think there's more to this. Obviously the traders think about their own interests, but there are strange rumours going around. Apparently, there's something better than artifacts there - something that ain't from this world, something alien or from another dimension altogether! They call it the Wish-granting machine. I heard a legend about a stalker who made it through. Only every time someone makes a wish the Zone grows and nobody who gets there uses his wish to make it disappear. I guess when you get to the Machine you don't give a shit about anyone else.
That's sad.
What do you want?
What did you hear?

Everyone who believes in the Monolith is completely nuts. They keep banging on about it but nobody actually knows what's in the center of the Zone. An invisible crystal that fell from the skies...ha-ha-ha! I reckon one of the secret labs blew up - I mean some stalkers used to work in a few of them. But, obviously, you can't bomb the Zone. Not only will the radiation spread all over the world, half of Europe would be flattened by the Zone's reaction. "Someone" has gone totally mad lately - I heard they're killing normal stalkers for no reason at all. How do you like that? Damn fanatics.
I think it deserves some attention.

I need to see your boss.
Why?
I have some very useful information.
Alright, go talk to the Captain. He will tell how useful that information is.
What is that information?
Map of Shining Path. It should interest you.
Alright, you can go. The leadership is in the bunker.
Barkeep told me that your leadership has some sort of assignment for me.

Yes, he let us know about you, but before we let you in I want to brief you on our rules. So listen, our rules are simple. First rule - it's forbidden to shoot on our territory. If you break the rule twice, our patrol will open fire on you. Even if you make a run for it, you won't appear on our territory again - our guards will make sure of that. If you act calmly, you won't have any problems.
Got it. Anything else?
Yes, that's enough. You can pass.
Got it. Anything else?

That's about it. If you want to try to join Duty, feel free. We need good men but I'm warning you: before being accepted, you'll have to do a few dangerous jobs. We don't need pussies so everyone is tested.
Halt! Outsiders aren't allowed in the Duty base!
What are you standing there for? Keep moving.
Go on, bro. Remember: Duty's mission is to cleanse.
Why don't you let outsiders in?
Where did you naive boys come from? There's a war going on, right? We’re fighting Freedom bandits! We have regular skirmishes with their fighters in the Wild Territory.
A war with Freedom? Why?
Because there is no place for those Freedom bandits in the Zone - they must be destroyed. If you're interested, go ask the Barkeep to explain everything. I'm busy.
Halt! Only members can go in there! We can't let you inside the bunker without a special pass. If you want to get one go see Colonel Petrenko. He's in the administration area across the yard.

What can I do for Duty?

That's a good question, Marked One and there's an equally good answer to it - kill Freedom anarchists. You'll get a reward for every PDA of theirs you bring and you might get promoted too. Take all the PDAs you get to Colonel Petrenko - he gives out the rewards. ÊÏÊ íàøèõ áîéöîâ òîæå íåñè åìó, ÷òîáû èíôîðìàöèÿ íå ïîïàëà â ÷óæèå ðóêè.

Äåëî òâî¸.
I am ready to swear the oath.
Good man! Repeat after me: "I, a stalker known as the Marked One, swear to defend the goals and ideals of Duty."
I, a stalker known as the Marked One, swear to defend the goals and ideals of Duty.
To protect the Earth from the dangers of the Zone, to seek out and destroy anything it spawns within and beyond its borders.
To protect the Earth from the dangers of the Zone, to seek out and destroy anything it spawns within and beyond its borders.
To fight any nonconformists, be they individual stalkers or groups.
To fight any nonconformists, be they individual stalkers or groups.
And to give my life in the name of justice and order on Earth!
And to give my life in the name of justice and order on Earth!
Congratulations! You are now a full member of Duty.
I completed the mission. I brought the RG-6.

Good job. This is what we exactly needed.\nMesser, you passed the test I were accepted into our clan. From now on you are a Rookie fighter of Duty. I will get some missions for you. For each of them completed you will be rewarded and perhaps even promoted. But, you also need to do our oath.

Îòëè÷íî, Ìå÷åíûé. Òû ïîìîã íàì óíè÷òîæèòü Áîðîâà, çà ãîëîâîé êîòîðîãî îòïðàâëÿëîñü óæå òðîå áîéöîâ Äîëãà, è âåðíóë âàæíóþ èíôîðìàöèþ. Òû õîðîøèé áîåö, è ÿ ðàä, ÷òî òû ñ íàìè. Çà òâîè çàñëóãè ïåðåä Äîëãîì ÿ ïîâûøàþ òåáÿ â çâàíèè äî âåòåðàíà Äîëãà. Èäè ê Ïåòðåíêî, îí âûäàñò òåáå íàãðàäó.
